script.ScriptApp.name: ScriptApp
script.ScriptApp.doc: Access and manipulate script publishing and triggers. This class allows users to create script triggers and control publishing the script as a service.

property.name: AuthMode
property.doc: An enumeration that identifies which categories of authorized services Apps Script is able to execute through a triggered function.

property.name: AuthorizationStatus
property.doc: An enumeration denoting the authorization status of a script.

property.name: EventType
property.doc: An enumeration denoting the type of triggered event.

property.name: InstallationSource
property.doc: An enumeration denoting how the script was installed to the user as an add-on.

property.name: TriggerSource
property.doc: An enumeration denoting the source of the event that causes the trigger to fire.

property.name: WeekDay
property.doc: An enumeration representing the days of the week.

method.name: deleteTrigger
method.doc: Removes the given trigger so it will no longer run.

argument.name: trigger
argument.doc: the trigger to delete

method.name: getAuthorizationInfo
method.doc: Gets an object used to determine whether the user needs to authorize this script to use one or more services, and to provide the URL for an authorization dialog.

argument.name: authMode
argument.doc: the authorization mode for which authorization information is requested; in almost all cases, the value for authMode should be ScriptApp.getAuthorizationInfo(ScriptApp.AuthMode.FULL), since no other authorization mode requires that users grant authorization

method.name: getInstallationSource
method.doc: Returns an enum value that indicates how the script came to be installed as an add-on for the current user (for example, whether the user installed it personally through the Chrome Web Store, or whether a domain administrator installed it for all users).

method.name: getOAuthToken
method.doc: Gets the OAuth 2.0 access token for the effective user.

method.name: getProjectTriggers
method.doc: Gets all installable triggers associated with the current project.

method.name: getScriptId
method.doc: Gets the script project's unique id.

method.name: getService
method.doc: Gets an object used to control publishing the script as a web app.

method.name: getUserTriggers
method.doc: Gets all installable triggers owned by this user in the given document, for this script or add-on only.

argument.name: document
argument.doc: a Google Docs file that may contain installable triggers

method.name: getUserTriggers
method.doc: Gets all installable triggers owned by this user in the given form, for this script or add-on only.

argument.name: form
argument.doc: a Google Forms file that may contain installable triggers

method.name: getUserTriggers
method.doc: Gets all installable triggers owned by this user in the given spreadsheet, for this script or add-on only.

argument.name: spreadsheet
argument.doc: a Google Sheets file that may contain installable triggers

method.name: invalidateAuth
method.doc: Invalidates the authorization the effective user has to execute the current script.

method.name: newStateToken
method.doc: Creates a builder for a state token that can be used in a callback API (like an OAuth flow).

method.name: newTrigger
method.doc: Begins the process of creating an installable trigger that, when fired, will call a given function.

argument.name: functionName
argument.doc: the function to call when the trigger fires

script.AuthorizationInfo.name: AuthorizationInfo
script.AuthorizationInfo.doc: An object used to determine whether the user needs to authorize this script to use one or more services, and to provide the URL for an authorization dialog. If the script is published as an add-on that uses installable triggers, this information can be used to control access to sections of code for which the user lacks the necessary authorization. Alternately, the add-on can ask the user to open the URL for the authorization dialog to resolve the problem.

method.name: getAuthorizationStatus
method.doc: Gets a value that indicates whether the user needs to authorize this script to use one or more services (for example, ScriptApp.AuthorizationStatus.REQUIRED).

method.name: getAuthorizationUrl
method.doc: Gets the authorization URL that can be used to grant access to the script.

method.name: create
method.doc: Creates the trigger and returns it.

method.name: onEventUpdated
method.doc: Specifies a trigger that fires when a calendar entry is created, updated, or deleted.

method.name: after
method.doc: Specifies the duration (in milliseconds) after the current time that the trigger will run.

argument.name: durationMilliseconds
argument.doc: the duration (in milliseconds) after the current time when the trigger should run

method.name: at
method.doc: Specifies when the trigger will run (plus or minus 15 minutes).

argument.name: date
argument.doc: a Date object representing when the trigger should run

method.name: atDate
method.doc: Specifies trigger will fire on the given date, by default near midnight (+/- 15 minutes).

argument.name: year
argument.doc: the calendar year to schedule the trigger

argument.name: month
argument.doc: the calendar month to schedule the trigger (should be a number between 1 and 12, inclusive)

argument.name: day
argument.doc: the calendar day to schedule the trigger (should be a number between 1 and 31, inclusive)

method.name: atHour
method.doc: Specifies the hour the trigger will run (plus or minus 15 minutes).

argument.name: hour
argument.doc: the hour at which to fire

method.name: create
method.doc: Creates the trigger.

method.name: everyDays
method.doc: Specifies to run the trigger every n days.

argument.name: n
argument.doc: the number of days between executions

method.name: everyHours
method.doc: Specifies to run the trigger every n hours.

argument.name: n
argument.doc: the number of hours between executions

method.name: everyMinutes
method.doc: Specifies to run the trigger every n minutes.

argument.name: n
argument.doc: the number of minutes between executions

method.name: everyWeeks
method.doc: Specifies to run the trigger every n weeks.

argument.name: n
argument.doc: the number of weeks between executions

method.name: inTimezone
method.doc: Specifies the timezone that the specified dates/time that the trigger will run in.

argument.name: timezone
argument.doc: the timezone with which to treat time information in the event

method.name: nearMinute
method.doc: Specifies the minute the trigger will run (plus or minus 15 minutes).

argument.name: minute
argument.doc: the minute at which to fire

method.name: onMonthDay
method.doc: Specifies on what date in the month that the trigger will run.

argument.name: day
argument.doc: the day of the month the trigger should be scheduled for

method.name: onWeekDay
method.doc: Specifies on what day of the week that the trigger will run.

argument.name: day
argument.doc: the day of the week to fire

method.name: create
method.doc: Creates and returns the new trigger.

method.name: onOpen
method.doc: Specifies a trigger that will fire when the document is opened.

method.name: create
method.doc: Creates and returns the new trigger.

method.name: onFormSubmit
method.doc: Specifies a trigger that will fire when a response is submitted to the form.

method.name: onOpen
method.doc: Specifies a trigger that will fire when the form's edit view is opened.

method.name: disable
method.doc: Disables the script from being accessed as a web app.

method.name: getUrl
method.doc: Returns the URL of the web app, if it has been deployed; otherwise returns null.

method.name: isEnabled
method.doc: Returns true if the script is accessible as a web app.

method.name: create
method.doc: Creates the trigger and returns it.

method.name: onChange
method.doc: Specifies a trigger that will fire when the spreadsheet's content or structure is changed.

method.name: onEdit
method.doc: Specifies a trigger that will fire when the spreadsheet is edited.

method.name: onFormSubmit
method.doc: Specifies a trigger that will fire when the spreadsheet has a form submitted to it.

method.name: onOpen
method.doc: Specifies a trigger that will fire when the spreadsheet is opened.

script.StateTokenBuilder.name: StateTokenBuilder
script.StateTokenBuilder.doc: Allows scripts to create state tokens that can be used in callback APIs (like OAuth flows).

method.name: createToken
method.doc: Constructs an encrypted string representation of the state token.

method.name: withArgument
method.doc: Adds an argument to the token.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: the name of the argument

argument.name: value
argument.doc: the value of the argument

method.name: withMethod
method.doc: Sets a callback function.

argument.name: method
argument.doc: the name of the callback function, represented as a string without parentheses or arguments

method.name: withTimeout
method.doc: Sets the duration (in seconds) for which the token is valid.

argument.name: seconds
argument.doc: the duration for which the token is valid; the maximum value is 3600

method.name: getEventType
method.doc: Returns the event type that the trigger fires on.

method.name: getHandlerFunction
method.doc: Returns the function that will be called when the trigger fires.

method.name: getTriggerSource
method.doc: Returns the source of events that will cause the trigger to fire.

method.name: getTriggerSourceId
method.doc: Returns the id specific to the source.

method.name: getUniqueId
method.doc: Returns a unique identifier that can be used to distinguish triggers from each other.

script.TriggerBuilder.name: TriggerBuilder
script.TriggerBuilder.doc: A generic builder for script triggers.

method.name: forDocument
method.doc: Creates and returns a DocumentTriggerBuilder tied to the given document.

argument.name: document
argument.doc: the document

method.name: forDocument
method.doc: Creates and returns a DocumentTriggerBuilder tied to the document with the given ID.

argument.name: key
argument.doc: the ID for the document

method.name: forForm
method.doc: Creates and returns a FormTriggerBuilder tied to the given form.

argument.name: form
argument.doc: the form

method.name: forForm
method.doc: Creates and returns a FormTriggerBuilder tied to the form with the given ID.

argument.name: key
argument.doc: the ID for the form

method.name: forSpreadsheet
method.doc: Creates and returns a SpreadsheetTriggerBuilder tied to the given spreadsheet.

argument.name: sheet
argument.doc: the spreadsheet

method.name: forSpreadsheet
method.doc: Creates and returns a SpreadsheetTriggerBuilder tied to the spreadsheet with the given ID.

argument.name: key
argument.doc: the ID for the spreadsheet

method.name: forUserCalendar
method.doc: Returns a builder for building calendar triggers.

argument.name: emailId
argument.doc: email ID of the user calendar the trigger monitors.

method.name: timeBased
method.doc: Creates and returns a ClockTriggerBuilder for building time-based triggers.

script.AuthMode.name: AuthMode
script.AuthMode.doc: An enumeration that identifies which categories of authorized services Apps Script is able to execute through a triggered function. These values are exposed in triggered functions as the authMode property of the event parameter, e. For more information, see the guide to the authorization lifecycle for add-ons.

property.name: NONE
property.doc: A mode that does not allow access to any services that require authorization. This mode occurs when an add-on executes an onOpen(e) simple trigger, and the user has installed an add-on in a different document but the add-on has not been used in the current document.

property.name: CUSTOM_FUNCTION
property.doc: A mode that allows access to a limited subset of services for use in custom spreadsheet functions. Some of these services — including read-only access to Spreadsheet service — normally require authorization, but are permitted without authorization when used in a custom function. Because custom functions do not include an event parameter, this value is never returned; it is documented only to demonstrate that custom functions run in their own authorization mode.

property.name: LIMITED
property.doc: A mode that allows access to a limited subset of services. This mode occurs when an add-on or a script bound to a document executes an onOpen(e) or onEdit(e) simple trigger, except in the case described for NONE.

property.name: FULL
property.doc: A mode that allows access to all services that require authorization. This mode occurs when an add-on or a script executes as the result of any trigger other than the cases described for LIMITED or NONE.

script.AuthorizationStatus.name: AuthorizationStatus
script.AuthorizationStatus.doc: An enumeration denoting the authorization status of a script.

property.name: REQUIRED
property.doc: The user needs to authorize this script to use one or more services. In most cases, the script will prompt the user for authorization the next time it runs; however, if the script is published as an add-on that uses installable triggers, the trigger will run the script without prompting for authorization but will throw an exception if the script attempts to call the unauthorized service.

property.name: NOT_REQUIRED
property.doc: The user has granted this script all the authorization it currently requires.

script.EventType.name: EventType
script.EventType.doc: An enumeration denoting the type of triggered event.

property.name: CLOCK
property.doc: The trigger fires once the time-driven event reaches a specific time.

property.name: ON_OPEN
property.doc: The trigger fires once the user opens the Google Docs, Sheets, or Forms file.

property.name: ON_EDIT
property.doc: The trigger fires once the user edits the Google Sheets file (for example, by entering a new value into a cell, which counts as an edit instead of a change).

property.name: ON_FORM_SUBMIT
property.doc: The trigger fires once the user responds to a Google Form. This trigger is available either in the Google Form itself or in the Google Sheets file that the form sends its responses to.

property.name: ON_CHANGE
property.doc: The trigger fires once the user changes the Google Sheets file (for example, by adding a row, which counts as a change instead of an edit).

property.name: ON_EVENT_UPDATED
property.doc: The trigger fires once an event gets created, updated, or deleted on the specified Google Calendar.

script.InstallationSource.name: InstallationSource
script.InstallationSource.doc: An enumeration that indicates how the script came to be installed as an add-on for the current user.

property.name: APPS_MARKETPLACE_DOMAIN_ADD_ON
property.doc: Add-on was installed by the administrator for the user's domain.

property.name: NONE
property.doc: Script is not running as an add-on.

property.name: WEB_STORE_ADD_ON
property.doc: Add-on was installed by the user from the Chrome Web Store.

script.TriggerSource.name: TriggerSource
script.TriggerSource.doc: An enumeration denoting the source of the event that causes the trigger to fire.

property.name: SPREADSHEETS
property.doc: Google Sheets causes the trigger to fire.

property.name: CLOCK
property.doc: A time-driven event causes the trigger to fire.

property.name: FORMS
property.doc: Google Forms causes the trigger to fire.

property.name: DOCUMENTS
property.doc: Google Docs causes the trigger to fire.

property.name: CALENDAR
property.doc: Google Calendar causes the trigger to fire.
